MS MCQs

    Explain DevOps Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality

    »

    1. Why is it difficult to pull together various processes into Continuous Delivery?

      Because increased deployment frequency leads to team burnout.

      Because Continuous Delivery requires a combination of people, process, and automation working together.

      Because the waste elimination process is more time-consuming than other processes.


    2. Which is the most important question to ask as a way to understand delivery performance in an organization?

      How many deployments does your organization achieve in a week?

      How does your organization identify and remedy deployment failures?

      How big is your deployment pain to production?


    3. Which of the following is a benefit of Continuous Delivery?

      Faster ROI

      Improved code production metrics

      Fault-focused monitoring


    4. What false assumption should you beware of when striving for Continuous Quality?

      Quality should be assured by tests conducted by a dedicated team

      Quality is primarily a marketing asset and yields few other benefits

      The more bugs that are found and fixed, the better the quality


    5. Who is primarily responsible for the existence of bugs in software?

      The product owner and the coder

      The product owner, the coder and the tester

      The coder and the tester
